media:group.media:title: What's New in Ardour 7.0
media:group.media:description:
Ardour 7.0 is a huge update with many great new features as well as a major under-the-hood change that improves MIDI authoring experience.
Learn more: https://ardour.org/whatsnew.html
Downloads: https://community.ardour.org/download
#ardour #daw #musicmaking #mixing #mastering

entry.title: Work In Progress: first demo of clip launching in Ardour

media:group.media:title: Work In Progress: first demo of clip launching in Ardour
media:group.media:description: Paul has been at work over the last couple of months adding clip launching to Ardour 7. Things are far from finished, and there's a lot left to do, but this video will give the first sense of one way that Ardour might present this functionality.

media:group.media:title: Ardour 6.6 : show automation on touch
media:group.media:description: A short video introduction to a new feature in Ardour 6.6 that makes it easier to do the kinds of things that Adam Neely likes to do.

media:group.media:title: User Interface: The Toolbar
media:group.media:description:
In this video we're taking the first but a very good look at Ardour's user interface. The Toolbar contains crucial controls for working with your session, so in this video I'll explain and demonstrate every part of it.
Learn more in the Ardour Manual: http://manual.ardour.org/ardours-interface/about/
Get Ardour: http://ardour.org
Check out unfa's channel: http://youtube.com/unfa000

media:group.media:title: Initial Configuration
media:group.media:description:
In this video you'll learn everything you need to know when running Ardour 5 for the first time.
How to go through the first run wizard? How to configure your audio interface? How to create your first Ardour session?
Learn more in the Ardour Manual: http://manual.ardour.org/ardour-configuration/
Get Ardour: http://ardour.org
Check out unfa's channel: http://youtube.com/unfa000
You can also watch on PeerTube: https://pe.ertu.be/videos/watch/225768a9-8bba-469b-8f74-fa569177ad74

entry.title: Example Ardour Session: "Learning Ardour" by unfa

media:group.media:title: Example Ardour Session: "Learning Ardour" by unfa
media:group.media:description:
This video shows the live playback of the background music from the "What Is Ardour?" video: https://youtu.be/YpMP8uGGpzI
It demonstrates an entirely "in-the-box" approach to creating music - with nearly all sounds and arrangements being created inside Ardour, using synthesizer and effect plugins, MIDI sequencing and automation.
Ardour can be used to make many different kinds of music, but we thought it might be helpful to show how the program looks and works with this particular piece and style. If you're thinking of using Ardour to record actual performances on various instruments (acoustic or electronic), the workflow will be fairly different, but the final result in terms what an Ardour session looks like will be similar.
Enjoy!
You can also watch on PeerTube: https://pe.ertu.be/videos/watch/c444d3c8-56af-4902-b30a-f7efd207fcc1

media:group.media:title: What is Ardour?
media:group.media:description:
Ardour is an open-source DAW for Linux, Mac and Windows. This video is meant as a quick overview of what Ardour is and what it offers.
Get Ardour: http://ardour.org
Check out unfa's channel: http://youtube.com/unfa000
You can also watch on PeerTube: https://pe.ertu.be/videos/watch/c444d3c8-56af-4902-b30a-f7efd207fcc1
